result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra L. Skendziel

records.addlTxt:
3:28 PM Defendant Cassandra L. Skendziel appeared by phone.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Cassandra L. Skendziel.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Von Davis-requesting on final status. Court reviews file. Preliminary hearing needed. Waived time limits. Bond to continue. Defendant to appear in person for prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Same conditions as previous bond apply.

1:03 PM Defendant Cassandra L. Skendziel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christian J Ness appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appears specially for the Public Defenders office. Court calls case and appearances. PD's office has yet to find counsel for the defendant. Court questions the defendant re: non-appearance. Defendant makes statement-did not have a ride to court. Defendant updates phone number. Defendant does not have the ability to post cash. State makes bond argument-requesting a small amount of cash to ensure the defendant returns to court. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes argument. Court sets bail.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:25 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 03:25 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

09:30 AM Defendant Cassandra L. Skendziel not in court.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews file-Atty Kurta has not yet been replaced as counsel. PD's office is unsuccessful at this time. Defendant was to appear in person and has not appeared. State makes argument. Defendant did appear at last hearing. State requests Warrant-Granted.

10:01 AM Defendant Cassandra L. Skendziel appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Kurta appeared by video for Cassandra L. Skendziel.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Waived time limits. Set for preliminary hearing. Bond to continue. Defendant to appear in person for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Christian J Ness appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cassandra L. Skendziel appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Kurta appeared by video for Cassandra L. Skendziel. Court calls case and appearances. The Court questions Atty Kurta. Atty Kurta request that DE may be able to appear by zoom due to circumstances. The Court questions Atty Kurta. The Court questions Atty Ness. Atty Ness makes recommendation. The Court reinstates signature bond and will not set warrant. Set out for initial appearance. Both attorney and DE may appear by zoom. Adjourned.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Voluntary appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:44 AM Defendant Cassandra L. Skendziel not in court.  Attorney Vincent Kurta appeared by video for Cassandra L. Skendziel.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. State makes argument-requests warrant for non-appearance. Argument from Atty Kurta. Court authorizes a bench warrant, but stayed until 7/13 @ 4:30.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:16 PM Defendant Cassandra L Skendziel appeared by video, in custody. Court calls case and appearances. Aaron Marcoux appears for the State. Atty Alysja Otten appears for the Public Defenders office. Court reviews probable cause. Court does find probable cause. Court questions the defendant.

Current Address:
N8596 Legion Lane.
Springbrook, WI 54875
#715-558-0608

Defendant does qualify for a Public Defender. State makes bond argument. No objection by Atty Otten.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
